title: Art for everybody
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Child development
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Art - Study and teaching
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Community education
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Child development
Crafts & Visual Arts/Art - Study and teaching
description: The function of an art gallery in the community. Sequences show the variety of interests a gallery can hold for people - exhibitions of great art from many nations, festivals of dancing and music. Even more important is the part a gallery can play in the development of imagination and talent in a child. Through happy participation in painting, modelling activities, costume-making and pageants, children learn about art.
